program_description: This program provides loan guarantees to eligible lenders to develop essential community facilities in rural areas.
program_facility_example_3: public safety facilities such as fire departments
applicant_eligibility_description: Eligible applicants include lenders with the legal authority, financial strength, and experience to operate a successful lending program.
eligible_lender_3: Farm Credit banks with direct lending authority
eligible_lender_5: Additional nonregulated lending institutions approved by USDA
eligible_borrower_2: Tribal governments and their affiliated organizations
eligible_project_type_1: Infrastructure projects such as roads, bridges, dams, harbors, and levies, along with irrigation improvements
eligible_area_description: Cities, villages, towns, townships, and federally recognized Tribal lands with fewer than 50,000 residents are eligible to apply.
eligible_lender_location: An approved lender can be located anywhere in the United States.
fund_use_description: You can use funds to purchase, build or improve essential community facilities, and to buy equipment and approved project expenses.
fund_use_example_3: Facilities and equipment that support distance learning and telehealth
borrower_info_source: Interested borrowers can ask their lender about the CF Loan Guarantee program.
lender_contact_description: Interested lenders can contact the USDA Rural Development Community Programs director in the state in which the proposed project is located.
local_office_help_description: Your local USDA Rural Development office can help.
note_disclaimer_1: Because information changes, always consult official program instructions or contact your local Rural Development office for help.
note_equal_opportunity_statement: USDA is an equal opportunity provider, employer, and lender.
